member.name: T:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode
member.summary: GeoCoder StatusCode

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.Unknow
member.summary: unknow response

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_SUCCESS
member.summary: No errors occurred; the address was successfully parsed and its geocode has been returned.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_BAD_REQUEST
member.summary: A directions request could not be successfully parsed. For example, the request may have been rejected if it contained more than the maximum number of waypoints allowed.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_SERVER_ERROR
member.summary: A geocoding or directions request could not be successfully processed, yet the exact reason for the failure is not known.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_MISSING_QUERY
member.summary: The HTTP q parameter was either missing or had no value. For geocoding requests, this means that an empty address was specified as input. For directions requests, this means that no query was specified in the input.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_MISSING_ADDRESS
member.summary: Synonym for G_GEO_MISSING_QUERY.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_UNKNOWN_ADDRESS
member.summary: No corresponding geographic location could be found for the specified address. This may be due to the fact that the address is relatively new, or it may be incorrect.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_UNAVAILABLE_ADDRESS
member.summary: The geocode for the given address or the route for the given directions query cannot be returned due to legal or contractual reasons.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_UNKNOWN_DIRECTIONS
member.summary: The GDirections object could not compute directions between the points mentioned in the query. This is usually because there is no route available between the two points, or because we do not have data for routing in that region.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_BAD_KEY
member.summary: The given key is either invalid or does not match the domain for which it was given.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.G_GEO_TOO_MANY_QUERIES
member.summary: The given key has gone over the requests limit in the 24 hour period or has submitted too many requests in too short a period of time. If you're sending multiple requests in parallel or in a tight loop, use a timer or pause in your code to make sure you don't send the requests too quickly.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GeoCoderStatusCode.ExceptionInCode
member.summary: indicates that exception occured during execution

member.name: T:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode
member.summary: Direction StatusCode

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.OK
member.summary: indicates the response contains a valid result.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.NOT_FOUND
member.summary: indicates at least one of the locations specified in the requests's origin, destination, or waypoints could not be geocoded.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.ZERO_RESULTS
member.summary: indicates no route could be found between the origin and destination.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.MAX_WAYPOINTS_EXCEEDED
member.summary: indicates that too many waypointss were provided in the request The maximum allowed waypoints is 8, plus the origin, and destination.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.INVALID_REQUEST
member.summary: indicates that the provided request was invalid.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.OVER_QUERY_LIMIT
member.summary: indicates the service has received too many requests from your application within the allowed time period.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.REQUEST_DENIED
member.summary: indicates that the service denied use of the directions service by your application.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.UNKNOWN_ERROR
member.summary: indicates a directions request could not be processed due to a server error. The request may succeed if you try again.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.DirectionsStatusCode.ExceptionInCode
member.summary: indicates that exception occured during execution

member.name: T:GMap.NET.MapProviders.OpenStreet4UMapProvider
member.summary:
OpenStreet4UMap provider http://www.4umaps.eu
4UMaps are topographic outdoor maps based on OpenStreetmap data. The map contains everything you need for any kind of back country activity like hiking, mountain biking, cycling, climbing etc. 4UMaps has elevation lines, hill shading, peak height and name, streets, ways, tracks and trails, as well as springs, supermarkets, restaurants, hotels, shelters etc.

member.summary: contains a short textual description for the route, suitable for naming and disambiguating the route from alternatives.

member.summary: contains a human-readable representation of the duration.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.DurationValue
member.summary: contains a value of the duration.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.Distance
member.summary: contains a human-readable representation of the distance, displayed in units as used at the origin (or as overridden within the units parameter in the request), in the language specified in the request. (For example, miles and feet will be used for any origin within the United States.)

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.DistanceValue
member.summary: contains a value of the distance.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.StartLocation
member.summary: contains the latitude/longitude coordinates of the origin of this leg. Because the Directions API calculates directions between locations by using the nearest transportation option (usually a road) at the start and end points, start_location may be different than the provided origin of this leg if, for example, a road is not near the origin.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.EndLocation
member.summary: contains the latitude/longitude coordinates of the given destination of this leg. Because the Directions API calculates directions between locations by using the nearest transportation option (usually a road) at the start and end points, end_location may be different than the provided destination of this leg if, for example, a road is not near the destination.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.StartAddress
member.summary: contains the human-readable address (typically a street address) reflecting the start_location of this leg.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.EndAddress
member.summary: contains the human-readable address (typically a street address) reflecting the end_location of this leg.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.Copyrights
member.summary: contains the copyrights text to be displayed for this route. You must handle and display this information yourself.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.Steps
member.summary: contains an array of steps denoting information about each separate step of the leg of the journey.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirections.Route
member.summary: contains all points of the route

member.summary: contains the location of the starting point of this step, as a single set of lat and lng fields.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirectionStep.EndLocation
member.summary: contains the location of the ending point of this step, as a single set of lat and lng fields.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirectionStep.Duration
member.summary: contains the typical time required to perform the step, until the next step. This field may be undefined if the duration is unknown.

member.name: F:GMap.NET.GDirectionStep.Distance
member.summary: contains the distance covered by this step until the next step. This field may be undefined if the distance is unknown.

member.summary: contains formatted instructions for this step, presented as an HTML text string.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the server has completed processing the call. It is illegal for the server to use any client supplied resources outside of the agreed upon sharing semantics after it sets the IsCompleted property to "true". Thus, it is safe for the client to destroy the resources after IsCompleted property returns "true".

member.name: P:Org.Mentalis.Network.ProxySocket.IAsyncProxyResult.AsyncWaitHandle
member.summary: The AsyncWaitHandle property returns the WaitHandle that can use to perform a WaitHandle.WaitOne or WaitAny or WaitAll. The object which implements IAsyncResult need not derive from the System.WaitHandle classes directly. The WaitHandle wraps its underlying synchronization primitive and should be signaled after the call is completed. This enables the client to wait for the call to complete instead polling. The Runtime supplies a number of waitable objects that mirror Win32 synchronization primitives e.g. ManualResetEvent, AutoResetEvent and Mutex. WaitHandle supplies methods that support waiting for such synchronization objects to become signaled with "any" or "all" semantics i.e. WaitHandle.WaitOne, WaitAny and WaitAll. Such methods are context aware to avoid deadlocks. The AsyncWaitHandle can be allocated eagerly or on demand. It is the choice of the IAsyncResult implementer.
member.value: The WaitHandle associated with this asynchronous result.
